alert.note: Alert for Madera; Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 4:11PM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Madera and Mariposa. In northern California, Tuolumne. * WHEN...Until 715 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yosemite South Entrance, Yosemite Valley, Yosemite National, Porcupine Flat Campground, Yosemite Creek Campground, Snow Flat, North Pines Campground, Lower Pines Campground, Yosemite Valley Vistor Center, Upper Pines Campground, May Lake High Sierra Camp, Little Yosemite Valley Ranger Station, Little Yosemite Valley Campground, Camp 4 Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding or high water is possible. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
